review_and_appreciate:
Review and Appreciate: Asking the question, "Who do I want to be?" helps you in your development. Find The
  Path.
quote: "Try not to become a man of success. Rather become a man of value." Albert Einstein

step_of_the_day.title:
Breaking down the question: Who do I want to be? Answer part of this question. What values or qualities do
  you want to embody? (Pillar #1)
step_of_the_day.content:
While the question of "Who do I want to be?" can feel huge, it is possible to break this down into its
  component parts. Although the sum is always greater than its parts. We typically spend a lot of time
  noticing what we are not, what we don't have. It's helpful to begin identifying the qualities that you do
  have and the qualities that you want to embody.

action_step:
We can break down the question by identifying some qualities that you want for yourself. Here are a
  few:"I want to be a person who is caring of others""I want to be a person who is persistent and can stick with a task or project""I want to be a person who has integrity""I want to be a person who is self-confident""I want to be a person who has courage""I want to be a person who is compassionate"Identify the qualities that you want to embody.
journal_entry: Write about these qualities you want for yourself or feel that you already have.
